quiz.title: Economics: Unemployment, Money, Liquidity Preference, and Money Supply

questions.question: Cyclical unemployment is caused by:
questions.explanation: Cyclical unemployment occurs due to downturns in the business cycle when aggregate demand falls and firms reduce production and employment.

questions.question: Which is NOT a function of money?
questions.explanation: The standard functions of money are: medium of exchange, store of value, unit of account, and sometimes standard of deferred payment. 'Measure of utility' is not a function of money.

questions.question: Liquidity preference theory was given by:
questions.explanation: John Maynard Keynes introduced the liquidity preference theory in his 1936 work 'The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money,' explaining the demand for money.

questions.question: What explains why the supply of money in circulation may increase, even in a closed economy?
questions.explanation: The money multiplier effect—through fractional‑reserve banking—allows an initial deposit to expand the money supply via lending, even in a closed economy (no international trade).
